adverb.description: And no one or nothing more besides; solely or exclusively.
examples: there are only a limited number of tickets available
genes that were discovered only last year

adverb.description: With the negative or unfortunate result that.
examples: she turned into the parking car, only to find her way blocked

adjective.description: Alone of its or their kind; single or solitary.
examples: the only medal we had ever won

conjunction.description: Except that; but for the fact that.
examples: he is still a young man, only he seems older because of his careworn expression

phrases: the building survived the earthquake, but only just
As recently as 1998 the average house price was only just over four times the cost of a Mondeo.
At the moment I'm earning a very basic wage, only just enough to keep going.
The road has been made so narrow in places that buses and lorries can only just get through.
So often you see club golfers arriving in a rush, only just in time for their tee-off.
